required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of PRUcalopride in Critically Ill Patients With Paralytic ILeus
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of Prucalopride in Critically Ill Patients With Paralytic Ileus; a Pilot Randomized Double-blind Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Paralytic ileus is a common intestinal dysfunction in critically ill patients. There are still no established the effective medications except correcting the primary causes and prokinetics trial which limited in efficacy and potential adverse events.

detailed_description.textblock: Prucalopride, a highly selective 5-HT4 receptor agonist, accelerates gastrointestinal transit which may reduce severity of ileus. Furthermore, there is no report of serious cardiac and neurological side effects. We aim to evaluate the efficacy of prucalopride as a prokinetic of choice on paralytic ileus in critically ill patients.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Consecutive enrolment parallel group in intervention group and placebo group
study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)
study_design_info.masking_description: The intervention was blinded to patients, nurse, investigators, and radiologist

primary_outcome.measure: Change of maximum bowel diameter from baseline at 24 hours
primary_outcome.time_frame: after first dose intervention to next 24 hours
primary_outcome.description: measure on plain abdominal radiography by blinded radiologist

primary_outcome.measure: Change of maximum bowel diameter from baseline at 48 hours
primary_outcome.time_frame: after first dose intervention to next 48 hours
primary_outcome.description: measure on plain abdominal radiography by blinded radiologist

primary_outcome.time_frame: after first dose intervention to next 72 hours
primary_outcome.description: measure on plain abdominal radiography by blinded radiologist

primary_outcome.measure: Change of maximum bowel diameter from baseline at 96 hours
primary_outcome.time_frame: after first dose intervention to next 96 hours
primary_outcome.description: measure on plain abdominal radiography by blinded radiologist

primary_outcome.measure: Change of maximum bowel diameter from baseline at 120 hours
primary_outcome.time_frame: after first dose intervention to next 120 hours
primary_outcome.description: measure on plain abdominal radiography by blinded radiologist

secondary_outcome.measure: change of abdominal circumference from baseline at 24 hours
secondary_outcome.time_frame: after first dose intervention to next 24 hours

secondary_outcome.measure: change of abdominal circumference from baseline at 48 hours
secondary_outcome.time_frame: after first dose intervention to next 48 hours

secondary_outcome.measure: change of abdominal circumference from baseline at 72 hours
secondary_outcome.time_frame: after first dose intervention to next 72 hours

secondary_outcome.measure: change of abdominal circumference from baseline at 120 hours
secondary_outcome.time_frame: after first dose intervention to next 120 hours

arm_group.description: Prucalopride (Trade name: Resolor) 2 mg oral or tube feeding once daily 5 consecutive days Decrease dose to 1 mg once daily in patient with end stage kidney disease or Cirrhosis Child Pugh C
Placebo tablet to mimic Prucalopride made by starch

intervention.description: 1-2 mg once daily enteral feeding for 5 consecutive days
1/2-1 tablet once daily enteral feeding for 5 consecutive days

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion:
- Medical patients with APACHE II score >= 15
- Paralytic ileus: small bowel diameter >= 4 cm or large bowel diameter >= 6 cm
Exclusion:
- no current prokinetic use
- Severe peritonitis or bowel inflammation
- ESRD needed hemodialysis

overall_official.affiliation: Faculty of Medicine, Prince of Songkla University

facility.name: Faculty of Medicine, Prince of Songkla University
